derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French laz, las (noun), lacier (verb), based on Latin laqueus 'noose' (also an early sense in English). Compare with lasso

encyclopedia.content: lace中文译名花边，又称抽纱、蕾丝，是指有花纹图案的、用于装饰的带状织物，实际上也是一种装饰带，属于抽纱产品。另外lace还有鞋带的意思。lace鉴别质量方式有以下 几个方面： 1：手感， 这个按客户的实际需要来判断 2：是否有破洞，是否有漏针和偏针。花型是否对称。 3：密度及幅宽：蕾丝面料和弹力花边都是从花高，密度，幅宽这几方面来判断。 4：颜色是否达到要求。

entry.def: Lace is a very delicate cloth which is made with a lot of holes in it. It is made by twisting together very fine threads of cotton to form patterns.

example.ex: She finally found the perfect gown, a beautiful creation trimmed with lace.
example.tran: 她终于找到了理想的礼服——一袭饰有蕾丝的美丽长裙。

entry.def: Laces are thin pieces of material that are put through special holes in some types of clothing, especially shoes. The laces are tied together in order to tighten the clothing.

example.ex: Barry was sitting on the bed, tying the laces of an old pair of running shoes.
example.tran: 巴里正坐在床上系他那双旧跑鞋的鞋带。

entry.tran: 用系带束紧;用鞋带系（鞋）
entry.def: If you lace something such as a pair of shoes, you tighten the shoes by pulling the laces through the holes, and usually tying them together.

example.ex: I have a good pair of skates, but no matter how tightly I lace them, my ankles wobble.
example.tran: 我有一双不错的溜冰鞋，可是不管我把鞋带系得多紧，脚脖子那里还是空落落的。

entry.tran: 在（饮料或食物）里掺入（少量的酒、药等）
entry.def: To lace food or drink with a substance such as alcohol or a drug means to put a small amount of the substance into the food or drink.

example.ex: She laced his food with sleeping pills.
example.tran: 她在他的食物里掺了安眠药。

entry.tran: 在（言谈或文章）里夹杂（某种话语）
entry.def: If you lace your speech or writing with words of a particular kind, you include a lot of those words in what you say or write.

example.ex: Fred liked to lace his conversation with military terms.
example.tran: 弗雷德喜欢在谈话中时不时蹦几个军事术语。

entry.def: If you lace your fingers together, you put the palms of your hands together and fold your fingers over, fitting the fingers of one hand between the fingers of the other.

example.ex: He took to lacing his fingers together in an attempt to keep his hands still.
example.tran: 为了不让双手发颤，他十指紧扣。

means.word_mean: 1. a cord that is drawn through eyelets or around hooks in order to draw together two edges (as of a shoe or garment)
2. a delicate decorative fabric woven in an open web of symmetrical patterns
1. spin or twist together so as to form a cord;

sentences.en: Her skirt was trimmed with lace.
The bride is wearing a wedding dress made of lace.
He is bending down to tie his shoelaces.
The child has learnt to lace his shoes.
sentences.cn: 这孩子已学会系鞋带了。

sentences.en: Lace your boots firmly or the lace will come undone.
sentences.cn: 把你的靴子系紧, 不然鞋带会松开。
